page.title: 12HOME LIFE IN DALRY(KIRK)
page.content: In this rural community, family life centres round the domestic hearth or, more accurately, the television set. The climate, albeit fairly mild, is not conducive to 'living in the street', although in the morning the shortest errand can take an hour, with passing the time of day with the neighbours. Everyone knows everyone and stops to talk. In the summer, gardening is the main activity,Dalry gardeners are keen and competitive,and much use is made of their produce for freezing,preserves and home made wine. The long winter evenings provide time for handicrafts of all kinds. Some of the womenfolk create beautiful embroidery, patchwork and knitting. They are also known for their baking, and find an outlet for these skills in the many 'bring and buy' sales and in home entertainment.
